div.p: RAMSAY, DAVID (1749-1815), American physician an historian, the son of an Irish emigrant, was born in Lancaste county, Pennsylvania, on the 2nd of April 1749. He graduate at Princeton in 1765, and M.B. at the University of Penn sylvania in 1773, and then settled as a physician at Charlestor South Carolina, where he had a large practice. During th War of Independence he served as a field-surgeon (1780-1781' and from 1776 to 1783 he was a member of the South Carolin legislature. Having acted as one of the â€œ council of safety at Charleston, he was, on the capture of that city in 178c seized by the British as a hostage, and for nearly a year wa kept in confinement at St Augustine. From 1782 to 1786 h served in the Continental Congress, and from 1801 to 1815 i the state Senate, of which he was long president. In 1785 h published in two volumes History of the Revolution of Sout Carolina, in 1789 in two volumes History of the American Revolt lion, in 1807 a Life of Washingtofi f and in 1809 in two volume a History of South Carolina. He was also the author of seven minor works. He died at Charleston on the 8th of May 181 from a wound inflicted by a lunatic. His History of the Unite States in 3 vols. was published posthumously in 1816-181; and forms the first three volumes of his Universal Histor Americanized, published in 12 vols. in 1819.
